page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: This land consists of undulating fertile clays and heavy loams split into an average of 20 acre fields with hedges containing deciduous trees. The holdings are mostly mixed family run farms. Corn grown is about 80% winter wheat, 20% barley with some oil seed rape and lupins. There are no dairy cattle but beef and sheep are popular. Lambing is done under cover. Most lambs go for meat. Horses for riding are kept, the old working horses being replaced by tractors costing about 15000. All corn growing farms have a combine harvester costing about 30000. Hay is made and carted using mechanical handling equipment. Market gardening is mostly winter greens, spring and salad vegetables. The orchards are apples and pears for direct farm sales and retail, the main outlet being a supermarket chain.
